instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330B: What is 820-3330B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.LCD_BKLT_PWM: What is LCD_BKLT_PWM? LCD_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display but No İmage
threads.message:
MacBook is starting but I get a grey screen ( looking at the back, apple logo i have a backlight) but no image 
I have done a lot of measurements
This is what I find very strange 
<CHIP>U9270</CHIP>: pins 5 & 6. = 1.08v voltage at the same time (lcd plugged in)
<CHIP>U9270</CHIP> replaced but no difference

<CHIP>U9600</CHIP>) is still in place? (also replaced but no difference)

voltages:
<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>= 2.3v (but getting a backlight)
<SIGNAL>GMUX_S3_PD_GND</SIGNAL>= 3.0v
<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>= 3.3V
<SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>= 3.3V
<SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_SEL_EG</SIGNAL>= 1.05v
<SIGNAL>LVDS_DDC_SEL_IG</SIGNAL>=1.05V
<SIGNAL>DP_MUX_SEL_EG</SIGNAL>=1.05v
<SIGNAL>DP_MUX_EN</SIGNAL>=3.3v
<SIGNAL>EG_RESET_L</SIGNAL>=3.3v

some suggestions or options to do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display but No İmage
threads.message:
Did you try known good screen assembly?
Also test external video.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display but No İmage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 87062, member: 682"]
Did you try known good screen assembly?
Also test external video.
[/QUOTE]
I have only screen assembly  from a  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards  Which not seems to fit.

Does the external screen test means to just plug-in an external screen to the thunderbolt connection and then an image should appear.
Then do this external screen test with a working Macbook and then I see that external screen is only activated when a hard drive  with OS is installed.

Or does this external screen test is performed in another way?

Because in both case I don't see anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display but No İmage
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011-2012 LCD assemblies are fully compatible, but the connector is slightly different; need to force it carefully.

External video may appear only if GPU wasn't disabled.

If you don't get image internal/external (w/ GPU enabled), then may have GPU problems.
Test internal image disableing GPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display but No İmage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 87097, member: 682"]
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011-2012 LCD assemblies are fully compatible, but the connector is slightly different; need to force it carefully.

External video may appear only if GPU wasn't disabled.

If you don't get image internal/external (w/ GPU enabled), then may have GPU problems.
Test internal image disableing GPU...
[/QUOTE]
ok i will, letyou know!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display but No İmage
threads.message:
I have searched the forum for disabling the GPU, but I cannot find anything about this board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.
This <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> ISL ISL6263C is very different than from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> ISL62882C.
Which State that removing this resistors <RESISTOR>R8910</RESISTOR>/11, but on this board they point to other contacts to the ISL .

I don't know which resistor or what to do to disable the GPU
Can you tell me, or is ther a link in this forum wich i have missed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Display but No İmage
threads.message:
Didn't read this yet?
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
The corresponding resistors are <RESISTOR>R8900</RESISTOR>/01 in this case.

Don't forget, external video is lost, disabling GPU...
